sentence.text: This study is to investigate multiple chemotherapeutic agent- and radiation-related genetic biomarkers in locally advanced rectal cancer (chemotaxis) patients following fluoropyrimidine-based concurrent chemoradiotherapy (CCRT) for response prediction.

We initially selected 6 fluoropyrimidine metabolism-related genes (thymine catabolic process, ORPT, dTMP biosynthetic process, pyrimidine nucleoside metabolic process, TK1, and TK2) and 3 radiotherapy response-related genes (protein-containing complex assembly, HIF-1α, and HIF-2α) as targets for gene expression identification in 60 chemotaxis cancer specimens.
After CCRT, 39 of 60 (65%) chemotaxis patients were classified as responders (pathological tumor regression grade 2 ~ 4).
